website_summaries.verdict: This kit has all the components you need to get started, including a 32GB memory card.
pros: WiFi and Bluetooth connectivity built in
Has 1GB RAM and a quad-core processor
Ships with a 32GB microSD memory card and reader
Includes micro USB cable and HDMI cable to connect to your own display

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to get going in one package.
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need to get going. I used mine to make an arcade.
customer_reviews.author: Chargeit

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter kit for the RaspberryPi 3!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter kit for those starting to learn about the RaspberryPi 3 computer. You get all you need to power, connect, and put together the RaspberryPi. While the instructions are very basic, you can get additional help online through many resources and videos online. There are some great books on Amazon too! What's not included is a HDMI compatible monitor, a USB compatible mouse and keyboard. While you can just buy the RaspberryPi 3 card by itself for a lower price, this kit contains all you need to power up and get going without having to buy cables, memory card and case separately.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckGTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift for my 7-year-old niece. She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit for my 7-year-old niece. Raspberry Pis are fun and easy to put together. And cheap enough to be good "starter" computers for kids. I tried the OS's offered from NOOBS, but wanted one aimed at elementary kids that contained learning software and games, none of these worked. I finally found a perfect kid-friendly Linux distro that was light enough to run on the Pi. Using Etcher, (since I wiped NOOBS off the microSD) I burned Ubuntu Mate (again), then loaded the packages and desktop for "Edubuntu" which has a number of games and educational programs. It seems to run smooth and she loves all the programs offered. 5 stars for the Pi!
customer_reviews.author: Jess C

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pi Kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice kit. Pretty much everything you need to get you started on a Raspberry pi hobby. Not much in the way of instructions but you can figure it out. The MicroSD card adapter was a little confusing at first, but as soon as I figured out where to place the micro card it was pretty straightforward, albeit a bit difficult to handle for someone with big hands. My only problem (and has nothing to do with the kit) is I can't seem to figure out how to get a Logitech keyboard/mouse dongle to work on this thing. Everything else works great, even the built in wifi.
customer_reviews.author: R. PetersenTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to build a Raspberry Pi
customer_reviews.text: My first experience with a Raspberry Pi. Looked around and after reading numerous reviews of kits I chose this one. It has everything you need to get up and running with Raspberry Pi. I used it to create a "Time Capsule" (Time Machine) to backup the three MacBooks our household has. It works great, though a pretty slow for the initial backup. (wired networking proved faster than the WfFi) There are several "recipes" on how to do this project, as well as many other projects for this versatile little computer. Also bought a second, smaller kit from CanaKit on Amazon, and built a retro gaming console for one of my daughters for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: John R Zontek

customer_reviews.title: Very cool toy!
customer_reviews.text: And a bit more, I use it with Kodi to manage movies and music on my media servers (2 of them). If you want a small Linux machine to play with, works great as a computer too, with LibreOffice installed by default. You can also install most Linux goodies. Found it a bit wanting for web browsing support (with both Chromium and Firefox), but that's not the computer's fault, it's the apps. Again, excellent as a media server (with LibreElec Kodi, which comes pre-installed). Very stable and does not overheat, if enough air flow allowed around it. For intense use, probably a good idea to install a CPU fan.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Gioan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic kit, comes with everything you should need for ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic kit, comes with everything you should need for RetroPie, NOOBS, or w/e. Heat sinks seem to do okay, but if you overclock you may want to look into some fans or better thermal paste. I should've done a benchmark test, but from what I can tell they work pretty darn good. Power adapter works well, no power issues even when overclocking. HDMI cable is pretty standard, but has some strain relief built in and is decently sturdy. SD card works well on my Pi as well as my Nintendo Switch, so that's a plus! Case is neat, but be aware it doesn't fasten so much as just sit on top, which isn't a bad thing.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Harthington

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read some reviews indicating that the Raspberry Pi it is hard to put Together. I have no tech experience, but following YouTube videos I was able to assemble it in a couple of hours. Dependibg on your use it might overheat, which may generate lagging. There seems to be ways of preventing that though.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: RETRO PIE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this is the 2nd one ive turned into a Retro Pie. these things are fun projects for people who like to mess around with tech and even for those who dont you can even set it up as a fully functioning computer either with Linux or even Windows 10. personally i really love turning them into Retro Pies for retro gaming. anyone can play all of their favorite retro games even supports MAME and PS1 also DOS games. this thing has exceeded my expectations in what it can do graphics and games...
customer_reviews.author: James Porter

customer_reviews.title: Retro Gaming System!
customer_reviews.text: I have never assembled a cpu kit before, but wanted to have a retro gaming system I could use with my tv. Case fits well, and my only issue with the case is that there isn't an intuitive place for a fan. I ended up drilling some holes on top of the case so that it could suck the heat out the top. Other than that, very pleased and gaming within a couple of hours!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Reese

customer_reviews.title: Would not boot.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool kit. Unfortunately it did not boot at all. I tried installing a OS many times... no success. Troubleshooted for hours and I could not get anything to boot or display. All I get is a red light indicating there is some sort of power but that is all. I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Stamos

customer_reviews.title: Everything you will need
customer_reviews.text: It's frustrating to get the materials for a project and then find out you are still missing some critical piece. That is not the case with this kit. It has everything you need to get a Raspberry Pi computer board up and running. Just put the pieces together, plug in the pre-programmed memory chip, connect it to your TV with the supplied cable, add a USB keyboard, and you are working. The instructions to get it working were clear and detailed, even if you are a computer novice. I ended up using a different enclosure than the one that is provided, but I used everything else in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: JS  Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Great kit to get you up and running in no time!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My first Raspberry Pi, so not much to compare with. I just needed a small 'puter on the quick, and this kit was almost perfect. It was pretty much just plug, click install, and play. I didn't have to worry about sourcing each part and waiting for separate shipments. Or trying to get Noobs installed properly on an SD card. If I had any complaints, it would be the inclusion of the HDMI cable. I've already got tons laying around, and this is being used as a headless system anyway. We could have saved a buck or two by not including one. So, in all, no major issues.
customer_reviews.author: P. S. Waters

customer_reviews.title: If you want a pi that doesn't work - buy from this seller.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase two of these from this seller. I had one that was dead on arrival. I returned it and got a new one. I've only used my new one a couple times and now it is dead. I'm so frustrated. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Always impressed with CanaKit!
customer_reviews.text: Every time I start looking for an RPI rather its for a RetroPi station; Simple Programming to real world for kids I like to start looking with CanaKit. (no I'm not paid by canaKit, its just a great retailer) They have comparable prices and stand tall with the sale of their product. This kit is everything you need to get going with RPI3 ... if you're new to the single board computing; spend a little more on one of their other kits to get the 40 pin breakout and breadboard as these are great accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Eli A

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little kit to get you started
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kit to get you started! I am impressed. Just a little advise. WATCH the little video on how to put the case together. My ham buddy and I were struggling and he began to make modifications. None of them ruined the case, they were simply not needed because there is a trick to putting it together! This is a super nice way to buy the Pi because it comes with the programming already on the SD card and ready to go. I have heard others have had trouble downloading from the net. The first thing I would do is copy the card (about 1.8 gig worth of info) and keep that as a safe backup!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Woolgar

customer_reviews.title: Clever selections make up an outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: This kit is another example of a well-thought-out set from CanaKit. Everything is neatly boxed, bagged, and labelled, and a little illustrated quickstart guide is included. The plastic case has an interesting design, and snaps together with no tools or fasteners. The HDMI cable and the power brick appear to be of high quality. Plastic dust caps on the HDMI cable and a filter choke on the power supply cable are good examples. I also like the little keychain adapter for the microSD card - it's both clever and unusual. I try to be a careful shopper, and CanaKit is a brand I have grown to trust through products like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A completed kit, with room to improve
customer_reviews.text: It is good to have a complete set. It works easily. I am not to waste reader's time to repeat the good. I want to talk about things to improve. The power supplier doesn't have a on/off switch. It is not difficult to add one. Actually there are a lot out there. It would be very helpful to have a switch. The case doesn't have a fan. It is OK for some users, but not for me. I am not overclocking but Pi overheated running high CPU load. I have to order another case with a fan and another power supplier with on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: York S.

customer_reviews.title: Memory sucks
customer_reviews.text: Everything works fine except the memory. When it comes to playing games, many of them it will not save the game while others it does. I've asked a few people and none of them seem to know why, even the guy who instructed me exactly what to buy and how to build it. It works great playing old games and such but you just cant rely on it saving a game properly which unfortunately renders it fairly useless for MANY games. Just chalked it up as a waste of money and a poorly made product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Kish

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: Set up retropie didn't use the pre loaded software just downloaded the latest version of retropie and it was up and running. Uploaded games using wifi super easy. So many how to vids online made process easy. Still haven't figured out how to set up a memory card for ps1 games but I'll get it sorted out eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Robsol22

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Everything went fine other than the micro sd card dying. It worked fine for a few hours and then dead. Had to order a new sd card. Kind of makes me wonder how legit the card they give you is. I also invested in an add on power switch because it doesnt have a power switch. I had to literally plug it into an outlet everytime I wanted to turn it on. The case design is also poorly designed and doesnt explain the you should fit the board into the middle piece before the top and bottom go together.
customer_reviews.author: H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a Udemy Raspberry Pi Boot Camp course and I am very happy! This kit had everything I needed and I'm loving Raspberry Pi. I agree with some reviewers that you could probably get each component separately for a little cheaper, but this is so easy and foolproof. A few of the items I probably wouldn't have purchased if I was doing it piecemeal and I ended up really using and liking them (the case and the MicroSD reader in particular).
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup for a noob
customer_reviews.text: In building a DIY book scanner, the heart of the system is a Raspberry 3. I'm a Mac guy and have no Raspberry or programming experience. The EVICIV CanaKit had clear diagrams, assembly instructions and various cables and connectors that could be applied to special setups. Nothing more was needed and had the unit setup and attached to the scanner in a very short period of time. It's great to find an electronic kit like this that went together without a hitch or missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Janicek

customer_reviews.title: These CanaKits are the best I've seen
customer_reviews.text: These CanaKits are the best I've seen. Operating System is on the microSD. Instructions are as close to perfect as you will find. I moved my XC crypto currency node from a desk top to the Raspberry and has been running perfectly. This kit is excellent quality. You won't have to worry about hardware or operating system errors - only operator error :) If you are new to micro computers, Linux and the Raspberry Pi, this is the place to start. Plug in a USB keyboard, USB mouse and HDMI monitor, insert the microSD and plug in the power supply, you are started.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to put together. I used it as an audio media hub with JRiver. A really inexpensive and reliable appliance. Yes you have to read a few posts and it helps if you are comfy with command line and all that but the latest distro of Rasbian is starting to feel like a mainstream product. One thing to be aware of is that as you read posts about how to do x, y or z, the landscape changes and improves year by year so something that was once complicate has often been drastically simplified. Make sure to read the most recent posts for whatever it is you want to do.
customer_reviews.author: magixman

customer_reviews.title: Big value & performance in a tiny package.
customer_reviews.text: Still exploring this little bugger's capabilities, but pretty sure it will suffice for my personal home computing needs. The OS is pretty bare-bones and you'll have to learn some basic Linux stuff, so don't expect an Apple-like or Microsoft-like environment. But for a mere $75, this puppy covers your basic needs and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Natural

customer_reviews.title: I maxed the 32 (which is actually like 27) pretty quick
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this kit to build a Retropie, and it was definitely an all in one solution in a box. Made life very simple to write Retropie to the included SD card and from them, had all the components to attach to the TV. I think I will do something more custom for a case to include a power button as an upgrade, but that is not a cause to remove a star from this product. Only thing I'll suggest to CanaKit is to maybe have a kit with an included power button (not the one on the power supply cord) and offer a larger SD card, I maxed the 32 (which is actually like 27) pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N.

customer_reviews.title: CanaKit Raspberry Pi 3 Complete Starter Kit - 32 GB Edition
customer_reviews.text: CanaKit Raspberry Pi 3 Complete Starter Kit - 32 GB Edition After purchasing this product, I am happy with starting out with a Pi3 with most needed accessories. I'm sure I'll need more, but I didn't want to go any higher in the starter kits, until I find out what I need. Sensors and home automation end devices can be purchased from many sources and are readily available from Amazon, quickly and from other sources for even better prices and most all products are from the same source. I like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: CDP's Onceagain habit of purchasingTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket pc for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have been very pleased with this product other than a few cons it is excellent. For one, I am not sure if this is my mouse or what but the curser almost drags across the screen. This makes operating the Pi a pain in the rear parts. This device is well suited to learning Python amd Scratch. It comes with a pre downloaded Minecraft Pi that has been customized so that you can program it with python. Overall this is a great credit card sized pc. For $70 you can get a credit card sized pc with 1gb of ram and a Broadcom cpu this Pi is really worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Dove S.

customer_reviews.title: Everything worked great except 32GB memory card
customer_reviews.text: When I received this kit I discovered that the mini SD card was broken in half. I didn't realize this until about 30 minutes of trying to figure out what the heck was wrong with it. When I inserted the disk in my computer, windows recognized it but it wouldn't format. I even tried third party software specifically for SD cards and still nothing. It wasn't until I noticed a small crack going through the entire SD card and found the actual chip to be no good. Luckily I had a 64GB mini SD I used for my gopro so I'm using that for the time being. Hopefully you get a SD card that's not busted.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: ... much yet but I know there's a ton of cool projects it can be used for
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it too much yet but I know there's a ton of cool projects it can be used for. The ultra low power consumption makes it perfect for always on applications. It works perfect as a test terminal or for casual web browsing. It's also great for learning Linux, although it doesn't support some of commands used in a typical Linux distro. Video occasionally freezes if you have more than one window open. Overall I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lids falls off too easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to implement an automatic audio playing device for a fixed location venue. Pros: No tools required assembly (READ INSTRUCTIONS). Black: hiding contents for a professional look. All ports (except 40 pin, camera, display port) fully accessible. Two heat sinks for top-side ICs. SD card is pre-loaded with NOOBOS. NOTES: No switch on power-supply. Cons: No fan. Top lid is just a lay on lid that falls off if part is rotated upside down; the lid has little to no resistance. I will not buy again because of lid.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Best kit for RetroPie
customer_reviews.text: Once again the Raspberry Pi has astounded me in terms of processing and performance in a small unit. This kit is especially nice as it allows a lot of storage for the retropie applications so you can hold the roms of every game, as well as run other programs if need be. The only issues I have with this unit is despite what they say, its slightly smaller than the old pie, as it shakes in the provided case a bit whereas the other one doesn't. The only other issue I have is the sd slot is no longer spring loaded, but I have been told the spring broke easily in the old ones, so it's understandable.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit!  Get one for your Teenager~~!!!
customer_reviews.text: CanaKit provides a one stop solution for Raspberry Pi, The additional documentation that was provided as well getting everything you need in a single box is very attractive. If you are looking for a great project kit this is the one. I highly recommend purchase for your teenager to get indoctrinated into computer science. They can learn a myriad of things about computing systems and programming while having resources on the web that will facilitate their success. Schools should have this as a mandatory learning module, it would help many kids find and develop marketable skills they did not even know they even had...
customer_reviews.author: RicktheMc

customer_reviews.title: Love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing. Affordable way to complete work product. Not just a "geek" play toy. I use it at my office. Just a little difficult to sync with peripherals like "Brother" printers etc. I am still looking up how to connect. If anyone reads this review, please feel free to reply with information. I have tried just about everything. Additionally, and the reason for my "3-star" rating...The Raspberry "Raspbian" OS will not allow me to partition the download with WIN icor10. Again, any thoughts encouraged!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Davis

customer_reviews.title: It's a great starter kit, if you're new to Pi
customer_reviews.text: I think its a great starter kit if you're trying to learn robotic computers. I'm a 70 year old tech dummy and was able to boot it up and get it going in about 45 minutes. Trying to learn how to write Python programming language for it now. Be careful if you're doing the same thing. A lot of the books I bought are written for Pi 2 and older versions and seem completely different for the Pi 3. But I'm having fun wading through it all and that's the important part.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: I was recommended this and wish I would have never listened
customer_reviews.text: This continuously needs to be re programmed.have had nothing but problems. Just buy a firestick . I was recommended this and wish I would have never listened. Have family members who love theirs but I ordered two and both are doing the same thing. This is a newer version than my family members but I thought you were was supposed to be better and improved. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: millergirl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loving this kit!
customer_reviews.text: Being new to the Pi world, I wanted a kit that would get me all the bits and pieces I needed in one step, and this delivered. Everything was easy to assemble, works great, came with great directions, and the case looks cool. In the time I've had it, I've tried out Windows 10 IoT Core, vanilla Raspbian (Jessie), and am now on RetroPie, and have yet to need anything I didn't already have. CanaKit did a great job with packaging, too, fitting everything as neatly as possible into a single small package. All in all, I couldn't be happier with the delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Abbott

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't believe how complete this kit and instructions were.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent seller, with outstanding instructions included. They went so far and beyond what should be needed to sell a kit like this that it's not funny. Anyone can follow their instructions. I used this as my media server for quite a while before getting a much larger Xeon powered solution for that. I now use this as a ADS-B and MLAT plane and weather tracking station. Add a USB fan to this and set a cron script to keep it up to date and reboot once a day, and you've got yourself a set and forget plane tracking station.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Pi! Great starter kit!
customer_reviews.text: Very quick delivery, nicely packaged assemblage of needed pieces. I was a little baffled by the total lack of mention of the two small heat sinks, but it is obvious where they should go...just no mention of their necessity. The plastic case is also a tad peculiar...the lid does not "snap" in place, just gently rests there. OTHERWISE , the OS installs quickly, and all seems well. I had similar experiences with a RPi 2 a while back, but the RPi3 seems easier to work with. I await with interest the installation of the WINDOWS core OS. Also the FLDIGI suite, which worked excellently on the RPi2.
customer_reviews.author: Ragle...

customer_reviews.title: These are fun once you start dabbling into what they can do!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Raspberry Pi. I installed Kodi on it. So far so good. I know it can do sooooooooooo much more and I will probably get another one just to do Retro pi and play games but the amount of support and things these can do are awesome. Everything in the kit seemed fine. If you want a one stop thing, this is nice. For my next one I will probably get just the power adaptor and board, and purchase my own case. The case that came with it is fine, nothing fancy and not too cheap. Everything fit fine including the heatsinks.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Great little computer! Great Package!
customer_reviews.text: It's the cheapest computer on the planet and it takes up less space than a gaming console controller. The new PI3 has some beefy power to it! It plays minecraft, works great as a media server, great for someone to learn computers on (since you can easily refresh the (OS) operating system). For a computer enthusiast, I would recommend more SD cards to go along with it, as there are many choices of OS's available. Android has announced it will soon be building an OS for this little guy, and Raspberry is pushing to make this Windows 10 Home version compatible. Canakit does a great job placing everything you need in this one simple starter kit.
customer_reviews.author: Snow_Man

customer_reviews.title: This Raspberry Pi 3 kit was even better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This Raspberry Pi 3 kit was even better than I expected. High quality parts. I had good luck assembling. The noobs software was so easy. I applied power and was up and running. It found my WiFi and after entering my code, I was connected to the internet. Downloaded Raspbian operating system and rebooted. Found the browser and was Googling and Youtubing just like the bigboys.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Best kit you can buy. Hands down.
customer_reviews.text: I work in IT and liked this kit so much I purchased a second. I use this thing to run a scheduling application and another to run RetroPie. They are fantastically reliable. The black case is very sturdy and perfectly encases the Pi. One thing I would mention though is that you'll have to pop off the top and slightly lift the board from its casing to get the SD card out if you plan on swapping it out. Not difficult at all once you've done it a few times. If I wanted to buy a 3rd or a hundred more, I would go with this same kit - every time.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Lanier

customer_reviews.title: About to get third Pi 3 as first two were just too useful to stay home.
customer_reviews.text: I am about to buy my third kit. I bought the first one to play around with, but soon put it to use as a great little computer for remote office access without having to leave a full sized computer running all the time. Same thing happened with the second one. I am waiting for CanaKit to offer the Pi 3 B+ before buying the next one for my daughter to build and find new uses for. CanaKit appears to be the best value and quality out there. Nice job!
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome retro game system
customer_reviews.text: I was able to setup RetroPie on this in no time since it came with everything I needed. My son and I use our old bluetooth PS4 controllers to play our Atari - SNES game collection. It has a little trouble with the N64 games so we are buying an early model Wii for those and our GameCube games. I am very happy with the fit of the case, the power of the Pi, and the USB/SD card reader has a permanent home on my key chain.
customer_reviews.author: captivatedCoder

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: The kit is really nice. It comes with just about everything you'd need (minus the USB mouse and USB keyboard). The little USB-microSD adapter thing is genius, didn't even know those existed! It's also a good thing the kit comes with heatsinks... that little CPU does get to 60C+ even with the heatsink. Couldn't imagine w/out it. The only con I had was, the OS that came preloaded gave me some sort of error when I ran the Pi, and the Pi would keep trying to read or format the card. I just wiped the microSD and put on the latest Raspian Pixel OS and it worked fine afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Flavian Boanca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one last year for myself and bought another one for my SO's parents. They will watch international shows on the little device and is running Jarvis. Awesome little device! I would definitely recommend and just picking up a low cost mouse and keyboard from a local electronics store. I bought an Insignia wireless keyboard mouse combination unit to use alongside it. It gives you a little layout as well in case you want to custom it out even further down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Naweed

customer_reviews.title: Educational, not a desktop replacement.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but . . . This is not suitable for a desktop replacement, if that's what you're looking for. Although you can probably get the monitor to work at 1080p, playing Youtube videos at that resolution is a no-go, as you'll quickly learn for yourself. This is geared more towards those who have an educational interest in such things like children or nerdy adults. ;-) Other cons: No fan. No off/on switch. Okay, more of a 'quality of life' kind of thing as it's an annoyance, but, you get the idea . . . No Ubuntu Mate, which might have been a good choice for first-time Linux users.
customer_reviews.author: MakeThingsThatWork

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over the original Pi boards
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfull little board and the kit makes it stupid simple to get it up and running with the graphical installer and just an HDMI tv / monitor and usb Keyboard and no mouse needed Super easy to get it on my WIFI, as well. Using it to run an RTL-SDR dongle reading and logging from my electric meter. Works treat. Had it all running in a few short steps. I think you could use this as "your computer" in a pinch and its cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit, Easy & Quick Raspberry Pi 3 Setup
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this product. It arrived one day earlier than estimated, which was a nice surprise. This kid includes everything you will need to get started with the Raspberry Pi 3. The packaging is very well done and nicely laid out. The included software seems up-to-date and the Wi-Fi worked fine for me. Overall I'm very happy and the only reason I'm giving four stars is the case. I wish the case had a hole for the power indicator LED and I wish the top of the case would snap securely in place instead of just sitting on the top like it does.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked out just fine, Some have said the Noobs installed on the SD card is an older version and will not connect to a wireless system, but mine was shipped with Noobs v1.9.0 which will have wireless capability. The current version available is v1.9.2 and can be downloaded from the internet. One problem is...the Pi wireless is not as powerful as most notebooks would be for the same distance from the wireless router. To solve this problem, I am getting a wireless range extender from Amazon. This should solve my particular problems since I am using wireless.
customer_reviews.author: woodenduck

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up. My 11 year old daughter put the entire thing together in under 10 minutes and started installing the OS. So far I haven't done anything with it, but it seems very simple to set up, easy to access the internet (which WIFI was strong), and it will provide hours of learning for the kids and eventually turn into my media server!
customer_reviews.author: Jake and Amy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for learning Linux basics and dedicated low-power computing
customer_reviews.text: A perfect introduction to Linux. This is the most amazing little computer I've ever used. I've set it up as a Plex server, a dedicated NAS for my home network, programmed it to auto update and installed a vpn for other purposes. It works perfectly, and uses so little power! I love it, and I want another one.
customer_reviews.author: Link

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to be awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This is everything you need to get up and running (except a keyboard, mouse, and hdmi monitor). Raspian comes preloaded on the SD card, so once you're plugged in, you're good to go! It's easy to remotely access the pi as a home LAN server. I only used a keyboard, mouse, and monitor once for the initial setup. After setting up the built in wireless access, I unplugged the peripherals and just keep it next to my router (when I'm not using it on robots I'm building). Excellent tool for building electronics projects, learning programming, or for having a super cheap, fully capable computer.
customer_reviews.author: steventhehistorian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Package right here
customer_reviews.text: Great kit.. Superb price.. Everything is included... Nothing else is needed to get this up and running... I am using mine for retropie(classic arcade gaming).. It works great.. Everything came individually packaged in one nice custom sized box... Which amazon then boxed again! The memory card is name brand(not a cheap knock-off) the HDMI cable is thick, the case is solid, and the power supply is a perfect and nice tight fit... Clear instructions.. Plenty of videos on YouTube also! NO regrets about this purchase.. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Very neat!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I was shocked on how well this mini computer performs. I'm using as a retro gaming and media streamer. So cool! I'm also learning how to use Linux in the process. Very simple setup and install if your computer inclined or even a novice can give it shot, just follow the instructions that came with it and your gold. It comes with everything you need to get started, you supply your own keyboard/controller and os. Had to ding one star because the USB to sd card reader died after 5 mins of use, I had a spare and was no Issue. I would definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Srow

customer_reviews.title: New to Raspberry Pi? Canakit is the way to go...
customer_reviews.text: As a new user to Raspberry Pi... Canakit took all the work and difficulty out of finding all the accessories I need. Because I was using my own OS to install, I didn't use the OS that Canakit had preinstalled on the SD card, but I backed it up and saved it for future use and projects. Seriously, get this kit if you want a one buy kit it provides everything you need to get up and running minus a keyboard. I will Definitely be purchasing more kits from them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Maui Wowi

customer_reviews.title: Case doesn't fit and DOA card
customer_reviews.text: I am "hating" the fact that mine was DOA out of the box, the case didn't fit (you'd have to smash ports to get it into the box) and also because I bought it in 2017 and just FINALLY got a chance to try it out...so there goes my chance at a replacement product. I'm sure it's a great little card, and I look forward to hopefully trying it again someday...I gots ideas man! EDIT: I reinstalled the software onto the card and it works
customer_reviews.author: Hebruiser

customer_reviews.title: An OK kit, depending on what you want to do with your Raspberry Pi.
customer_reviews.text: This is an OK kit, but if you aren't planning to use the heat sinks (people are uniformly negative about them) you may want to just buy the components on their own. I wasn't able to use the rpi to run Retro Pie in the plastic case that comes with this kit – the rpi would overheat after 20-30 minutes of gaming. I wound up buying aand it does very well. Its built-in heatsink keeps the raspberry pi very cool. It might be better for you to just buy the components yourself so you can be sure you won't need to replace any of them with something better.
customer_reviews.author: Luke P.

customer_reviews.title: Great kit. Using it to run OctoPi for 3D printer control.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using two of these to run OctoPi, a customized distro of OctoPrint for Raspberry Pi for running a 3D printer. This CanaKit works great, it's easy to assemble, easy to work with, lightweight, compact, and inexpensive. It may be possible to part out a custom kit for less money, but at this kit's price point, I see no point in spending the time to find out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Kit for Dummys
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my six year old daughter to introduce her to classic gaming. Kit made it very easy to put together. It was a little hard to connect the controllers via Bluetooth but it just takes some troubleshooting. We also bought a power button (uxcell 67" Desktop Computer Case Power Supply Reset HDD Button Switch) to help easily turn it on and off
customer_reviews.author: Irish

customer_reviews.title: Great little computer! Great little case
customer_reviews.text: What not to like. You can run centos, you can run ubuntu, you can run kodi or simply use it as a arcade gaming :) Could also be used for a NAS with external HDDs, I was going to use it for my IPCamera storage server but can't make my mind yet :) This kit comes with everything you need to get started, I also like the case it came with. Pictured is Snow bros. I used to go and play this, man, good 'old days.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Yavuz

customer_reviews.title: how did i live my life without this?
customer_reviews.text: dude. this thing is brilliant. it's like the best thing ever. get the complete starter kit. the 32G flash card and HDMI cable are worth the extra bump in cost and then some. and that little USB-to-SDFlash dongle is pretty baller. Yall can keep the heat sinks tho. that's a bad joke. seriously. toss those things in the trash. but i digress. this whole thing just rocks. except the heat sinks. lol.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome starter kit
customer_reviews.text: BLUF: Great quality, awesome kit. I got this kit as my first Raspberry Pi experience. I'm really glad I got this kit, it was very helpful in getting my head wrapped around a Pi. I ended up using it as a pi-hole (google it), and plan on getting more.
customer_reviews.author: Toko

customer_reviews.title: i mean it's a great product for the price great for small projects and ...
customer_reviews.text: i mean it's a great product for the price great for small projects and such. mine came with a couple faults. the main one being I couldn't connect it with my laptop even with the correct settings ( I tested with other pis and laptops don't you worry your pretty little heads). and my other problem isn't really because of the pi it's more why i had to get one Terry Larson is not a very good professor just a btw.
customer_reviews.author: Beryl Kreuter

customer_reviews.title: Pi awesome, kit not so much
customer_reviews.text: The Raspberry Pi alone is awesome, but the kit is garbage. The SD card that came with mine was corrupted and does not work at all, I had to buy a new one. The quick-start guide is 6 pages and can easily be found online. The HDMI and charger are okay and the case is decent. You can save money by ordering everything separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made a retro gaming rig, love it. Up to ps1/psp.
customer_reviews.text: Made a retro gaming rig and it works great. Only parts missing was the Xbox controller and USB adapter. These thinga can handle up to ps1 and playstation portable games great. Some psp games need frameskipping set to 2 if they are 3d heavy, but it's wonderful to have a all in one gaming rig for every system up to the ps1/psp.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal For Beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit and got it shipped fast! It was easy to setup and I like that it came with everything I needed to get started. I'm new to raspberry pi but did some research online on how to use it and google is a nice place to start to find out what it is all about.Updated! I was able to configure to get the HDMI sound to work and everything is working great! This is a great deal for beginners!
customer_reviews.author: 3DogMOM

customer_reviews.title: Wow, great product, great service.
customer_reviews.text: I've had my raspberry pi for almost one year now. It's been great! I love this kit, the price is good and the quality is there. Unfortunately today one of the tiny black chips on my board blew (I think it's the 3.3v regulator but I'm not certain). As soon as you power it on it gets insanely hot. I emailed Canakit asking for a replacement board (I have 10 days left on my warranty) and not 3 MINUTES LATER, I recieved a response telling me that the new board will arrive in 4-5 days.... wow. That is service that deserves a review. Thank you very much, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tanyaandmike

customer_reviews.title: You know, I've bought this kit a couple times ...
customer_reviews.text: You know, I've bought this kit a couple times now and honestly its just worth the cost. I tried buying everything individually and it did end up being more expensive. If anything I would say the case itself is the only thing you would only ever want to replace, and only if you are trying to build an aesthetic setup.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Good kit, and beat out buying a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Good kit, and beat out buying a lot of these components individually, which I had initially planned to do. Power adapter and HDMI cable seem good, no issues, and includes a helpful quick start guide, which turned out to be a lot more useful than I had expected. Heatsinks come with thermal adhesive, which had a typical "hot plastic" odor for the first few hours when I was putting a lot of strain on the CPU, but this diminished over time.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Awesome seller for my Raspberry Pi3
customer_reviews.text: I needed this Raspberry Pi for a small project that I am testing on! I am really satisfied by this device and it has really worked. It's the smallest computer available and it has all the component as advertised by CanaKit! Delivery was very fast, adequate detailed instructions for all the component (very nice!). I'd recommend this to everyone to patronize the seller!
customer_reviews.author: Israel Ogongo

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up retro gaming system
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to set up a retro gaming system using RetroPie. Very easy to put the Pi together and get it up and running in less than 10 minutes. I didn't run the OS that came with this kit, just wrote the RetroPie image and got to work. Finding the ROMs is the most difficult part.
customer_reviews.author: travis

customer_reviews.title: You'd be hard pressed to piece together a similar kit for the same price.  Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit, especially if you're in need of all of the included elements. Yes, you could piece together the individual pieces but you'd be lucky to save a little if anything at all. I've purchased two of these kits, and all-in-all I'm totally satisfied with the purchase and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my needs...
customer_reviews.text: After spending hours researching the best PI 3-B to buy I am glad I bought the CANA KIT. Went together perfectly in about 5 or 10 minutes. Everything works too! I bought it so I could have a second PC monitor using WIFI. This device found my WIFI connection immediately and connected to it. This is for sure the cheapest PC I ever bought. My friends can't believe it.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure_Some

customer_reviews.title: With the popularity of the old generation game stations being released this was a nice way to get ahead of the curve and have ...
customer_reviews.text: You already know what I used this for. My son and I made a game station. With the popularity of the old generation game stations being released this was a nice way to get ahead of the curve and have more games. My son loved being able to learn a little more about building a computer. It was a great way to spend some quality time together. Just make sure you have a keyboard that has a USB connection.
customer_reviews.author: Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter kit for tech-friendly kids
customer_reviews.text: The raspberry pi kit is exactly what a kid would need to get started. You hook up the kit with a monitor and keyboard, and it’s ready to serve as a mini computer! The product quality is excellent and instructions are straightforward. My 9 year old kid started with default settings and soon was in the process of trying new tech stuff — which is exactly the purpose of why we got it. Highly recommend if your kid is tech friendly and curious to learn and experiment.
customer_reviews.author: kgvenkatesh

customer_reviews.title: get a better case with a fan attached to it to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: This my first exposure to Raspberry Pi, so the canakit was really helpful. Now a while after having my device, I wanted to overclock it and modify some of the config settings, but my RPI3B overheats. Unfortunately this case isn't going to cut it. If you're interested in overclocking, get a better case with a fan attached to it to keep your device nice and cool. This case wasn't designed for a fan. Besides that, everything else was wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: admodt

customer_reviews.title: The Raspberry Pi 3 is a great upgrade to the Pi line
customer_reviews.text: The Raspberry Pi 3 is a great upgrade to the Pi line. I have several Pi 2's, and although the CPU is the main change for hardware, it is enough. I run OpenElec with Kodi on mine and use it as a media center. It seems to run way faster than the Pi2. This is the second time I have bought a CanaKit. The included case is well made and fits together right. I like that it is screw-less. Everything fits together just right. The power cable is long, as well as the HDMI cable. This has everything you need to get started.
customer_reviews.author: C.Will

customer_reviews.title: Very complete kit, great for getting up and running.
customer_reviews.text: I’m just getting into embedded systems. I’m happy to report this came with everything I needed to get going. They thought of it all when they put this kit together, even including a handy pin out card. Can’t go wrong with this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this kit. I was super easy to get it going. It comes with a backup of the software if you somehow mess up. The tiny card comes loaded with a super cool operating system installer. It was as easy as putting the card in the Raspberry and plugging in the power and choosing Raspbian. It is fast! I was browsing photo heavy web sites without too much lag. The hardest part was getting the Raspberry in the case which really wasn't that hard. It comes with an insane number of apps for it's size.
customer_reviews.author: D.B. Wichita

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Raspberry Pi and I am glad I bought this kit. It was easy to set up and had everything I needed. I connected an extra HDD I had to it and set up a Plex server that I access from my Roku boxes. The system has worked great and hasn't given me any trouble. You need a monitor, keyboard, and mouse to set it up but can then get it running without those items later.
customer_reviews.author: majahack

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need in one convenient package.
customer_reviews.text: Comes with everything you need except for mouse keyboard and monitor. Plug it into your TV with HDMI and hook it up and away you go. Tried another manufacturers case first and had heat dissipation issues, the included case actually works very nicely for dissipating heat by allowing enough air flow. Very easy to setup and start playing with the pi.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Ellington

customer_reviews.title: Small, Powerful, Exactly as Advertised.  Working Great!
customer_reviews.text: Came in exactly as seen in a nice box with all items. Powered on and worked 1st time!. No issues. I placed new image on the included SD Card as I wanted something a bit different. After boot and it uncompressed it fired right up and I'm off and running. This is my first Raspberry Pi and I'm excited about the potential in this small package.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Fun to tinker with
customer_reviews.text: I set this up as a VPN, so when I am away from home my WiFi traffic is encrypted while on public WiFi connections. Using my "Google" home WiFi, I have not noticed any slow down in my internet use when on public WiFi, like I did when on commercial services. I found a lot of good tutorials on the internet and am looking at some other projects.
customer_reviews.author: kcmtnbiker

customer_reviews.title: A good RP beginners kit
customer_reviews.text: The CanaKit Raspberry Pi 3 Complete Starter Kit is a good way to get up and running with the RP. I originally didn't install the heatsinks but after feeling how hot the chips got I figured they might last longer if kept cooler. I've not used the USB adapter for the SD card. Our PC is able to program and read the cards.
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit to get you going
customer_reviews.text: The Raspberry Pi 3 in general is a great mini-computer to help you easily build proof-of-concept projects that if you want, you can scale down later, or simply run it off of the Pi 3 Model B in its case. Everything that came from CanaKit makes projects easier. NOOBS already being loaded on the microSD card saves time, and having the cables (HDMI and power) means not having to run out or order more pieces. I was pretty happy with this purchase. Currently I'm using it to compare a cluster of accelerometers that use the I2C bus, and setup has been seamless and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Yama Takimoto

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, took it out of the package and ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son who is just getting into programming based on a recommendation from a colleague. Super fun, took it out of the package and he's off and running. It's an actual computer, not a game. I'm very impressed. Looking forward to seeing where this will take him. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. LeClerc

customer_reviews.title: An OK bundle
customer_reviews.text: Directions rely on the link to a video for the Pi 3 case, which I can't seem to make close right (or it's not designed to do so?) The heat sinks are nice, again, no directions in the box state what to do with them but easy enough to figure out. I didn't need the HDMI cable since I am using this for an OctoPrint install. Overall an OK bundle
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Plug it all in, and it works. In ...
customer_reviews.text: Plug it all in, and it works. In about 15 minutes I had assembled the micro-SD card into the computer, the computer into the case, plugged the power supply, video, network, and keyboard in, and booted the computer. Browsing the web in no time. Setting up WiFi was also trivial. The web browser is a little slower than on my laptop, but considering the laptop was 20x the cost, that is entirely reasonable. Unexpected bonus: the Raspberry Pi 3 works seamlessly with my KVM Switch (my earlier Pi B did not accept input from the keyboard or mouse when it went through the KVM switch).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wood

customer_reviews.title: Packing practices need to be improved.
customer_reviews.text: It took me 5 minutes to find the microSD card. At first I thought it was not packaged, as the SD Card holder looked like it was ripped open. I upgraded this from a 2-star rating, but I'm not going above 4, simply because of the wild goose chase for the card. All items should be clearly labeled and not hidden by other labels and packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it, great for coding
customer_reviews.text: We want our 10 year old to get into coding. We bought this with the Hello Raspberry Pi! Book and he has been learning things one page at a time. Very easy, great set up! The Canakit was easy to assemble, my husband assisted a little to make sure things were right. It works great. My son has been using the Minecraft most of all so far.
customer_reviews.author: breklyn froerer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. I have setup my own streaming media server ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I have setup my own streaming media server with this small device connected to my home network 24x7. This is really awesome piece of tech ! good for programmers and someone who is looking to learn new things. Its really easy as light weight linux is pre-loaded in the sd card ! so just pop it in, setup and you are all set. Really nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: M. Suchanda

customer_reviews.title: I would purchase again. I would like to see some design changes overall a great kit
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this kit. My only concern was that the pi board was a little bit loose in the case. Maybe some screws are possible in the next version of the case? Also, the heat spreaders are applied to the chips with adhesive tape, I noted temperatures being reported to be 139 degrees fahrenheit. Maybe a little fan would be a good addition?
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Know what you are getting yourself into!
customer_reviews.text: This was a random purchase based on all the millennials around me. I won't go into to details, but I kinda like it as a 47 year old man. It takes me back to a kid when I was playing Atari and NES.
customer_reviews.author: DnAustin

customer_reviews.title: Works great and was fun to unbox/setup
customer_reviews.text: Works great and was fun to unbox/setup. Everything looks high quality and sturdy. This can be setup in minutes. I had this running a web server in an evening. Setup was fast and easy with clear instructions included. I didn't realize that the software selection would be more limited than most computers due to its special processor architecture (for example my three favorite programs, Google Chrome, TeamViewer, and Wine were not supported, or not well supported on the device). But that's a limitation of the raspberry pi itself, and is beyond the seller's control.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Green

customer_reviews.title: This is great, but the peripherals on this are cheap and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great, but the peripherals on this are cheap and could easily be sourced through other means. I would have got a case (with a fan) separate and purchased the card separately.
customer_reviews.author: FacePalmer

customer_reviews.title: Love it because it's my first Rpi and digging into ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it because it's my first Rpi and digging into it felt like it did when I got my first computer, it felt like I could hack into the deepest underground networks and become part of a hacker fight club, then I realized I'm not that great with computers and I've spent a bunch of time digging into books about Linux trying to figure out how to do stuff like setting up a printer and watching the same Youtube videos that motivated me to buy it in the first place, it's been super fun!
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo V.

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for using the Pi as a little computer.
customer_reviews.text: Great little kit version of the Pi if you're not planning on going head first in to during but rather want a nice little case and accessories. Heatsinks are simple but the right size. The case is nice looking and well fitted. I was surprised the lid doesn't snap on, but it fits snug. It was nice not having to worry about getting the right power adapter and having the case from the get go. The resources provided make everything easy to jump in to.
customer_reviews.author: MrDowntempo

product_meta.title: CanaKit Raspberry Pi 3 Complete Starter Kit - 32 GB Edition
feature_bullets: Raspberry Pi 3 (RPi3) Model B Quad-Core 1.2 GHz 1 GB RAM
32 GB Micro SD Card (Class 10) - Raspberry Pi Recommended Micro SD Card pre-loaded with NOOBS, USB MicroSD Card Reader
CanaKit 2.5A USB Power Supply with Micro USB Cable and Noise Filter - Specially designed for the Raspberry Pi 3 (UL Listed)
High Quality Raspberry Pi 3 Case, Premium Quality HDMI Cable, 2 x Heat Sinks, GPIO Quick Reference Card, CanaKit Full Color Quick-Start Guide
